title: Opec and allies extend oil production cuts to end of July
text: Nigeria and Iraq also agree to cuts as prices begin to recover with coronavirus lockdowns easing

title: We have the worst we have seen in the US since the Great Depression... arguably the Civil War: Sachs
text: On this episode of Yahoo Finance Presents, Columbia University Professor and author Jeffrey Sachs sat down with Yahoo Finance Editor-in-Chief Andy Serwer, to discuss his new book "The Ages of Globalization," the current protests, Covid-19, unemployment, the economy, Trump policies, and more.

title: Why The US Economic Recovery Will Fall Short of Forecasts
text: Market pundits seem to have strong opinions about how fast or slow the US economic recovery will be once it starts. Such clairvoyance is stunning given the uncertainty of the current GDP forecast, which is already two-thirds in the books.

title: OPEC and its allies reach deal to cut oil production through July
text: OPEC and all but one of its allied countries agreed on Saturday to extend record oil production cuts through July.

title: What Does a Stock Market Topping Pattern Look Like?
text: I love today’s featured photo. If you see it right side up, it looks like a piece of deadwood coming out of the tree trunk.

title: Bears May Have To Be Patient
text: Equity indexes are in overshoot mode.

title: Jobs Bounce In May, Markets Don’t Leave Margin For Error
text: May's jobs numbers were strong, but surprisingly the market isn't pricing in much risk in any recovery.

title: Why The Stock Market Is Up With 42MM Americans Out Of Work
text: Stocks have soared despite high unemployment and social unrest.

title: 'My first reaction was disbelief,' on May jobs report, says Commonwealth Financial CIO
text: As the daily spread rate of the coronavirus drops to about 1.1%, the lowest rate since the epidemic started, and testing improves, many Americans are optimistic about the pandemic.

title: There ‘Definitely’ Will Be Another Stimulus Package, Trump Economic Adviser Says
text: A surprisingly positive jobs report threw the possibility of another coronavirus aid package into question.

title: Stop Whining - The Stock Market Rally Has Been Based On Fundamentals!
text: It seems that virtually every pundit and economist who missed the stock market rally is claiming it wasn’t based on fundamentals.

title: OPEC and allies reportedly agree to extend record production cut
text: Some of the world's largest oil producers will meet on Saturday to decide on whether or not to extend production cuts.

title: Wall Street's latest surge isn't benefiting many Americans
text: While the U.S. economy is showing signs of life as businesses reopen and job growth rebounds, the gap between the real economy and the stock market remains unusually wide.

title: Investment in ESG 'should at least double' this year, researcher says
text: As Environmental, Social and Governance-based investments rise in popularity and performance, investors are set to continue buying in, says Tom Lydon, CEO of ETF Trends.

title: All of a sudden, people are talking about a V-shaped recovery again: 'The stock market had it right'
text: The astonishing pickup in payrolls during May has rekindled hopes that the economic slump may not be nearly as bad as it looked.

title: May's job numbers were strong. But don't celebrate just yet
text: For the month of May, many economic forecasters anticipated the recent surge in layoffs to continue outpacing new hires. But, surprisingly, the latest US jobs report showed just the opposite.

title: The widely cited 'disconnect' between Wall Street and Main Street suddenly appears less confounding
text: Friday's rally pulled the S&P 500 just about even for the year. Including dividends, the market's total return for 2020 is positive.

title: How to Buy Stocks You Normally Can't Afford
text: A stock's high price tag no longer has to be a barrier to buying it.

title: OPEC and allies to agree one-month extension to output cuts
text: OPEC and its allies led by Russia are "most likely" to agree on a one-month extension to an oil production cuts deal on Saturday, an OPEC delegate said.

title: Don’t Lose the Thread. The Economy Is Experiencing an Epic Collapse of Demand.
text: A rip in the fabric of the economy won’t be healed easily, and denial of the severity of the crisis won’t solve it.

title: Coronavirus Shutdowns: Economists Look for Better Answers
text: Researchers are developing models for more targeted closings (and reopenings) that would curb the spread of infection at a less severe economic cost.

title: S&P 500 Weekly Update: The Secular Bull Market Rolls On
text: The equity rally surges ahead leaving the majority of investors in disbelief. In a Secular bull market, the surprises occur on the upside.
